knimeNode.name: Backward Feature Elimination End
knimeNode.shortDescription: End node for a backward feature elimination loop

fullDescription.intro:
This is the end node of a backward feature elimination loop. It compares the target column, which has been set in the start node, with the prediction column set in this node's dialog. For numerical columns the squared error is computed, for all other columns the error rate. The column that caused the smallest error when left out is then discarded for the next iteration.
The node's output table shows the error for the different levels of the elimination process, and the column that has been excluded in the level.
fullDescription.option: The column that contains the predicted values

ports.inPort: The result table of a predictor inside the loop
ports.outPort: Elimination levels and corresponding error rates and left out columns
The elimination levels as model that can be used in a backward elimination filter node
